Cheers for the info Benoit! I'll be down at the event on the day sharing a beer with you
Anyway, if you are interested, just comment of this thread or send me a PM. There is room for many of us (10 meters!)
Only one (big) deal among us: I sell alcohol, you sell whatever else. If you want to sell alcohol too, I take a commission.

I'll be already busy with the 650 already interested in the event, so I cannot take care of this but I can book the place for you. If you want to sell food (even do a BBQ) it's OK but you have to tell me soon and I'll register it to the firemen station, I will also lend you a fire extinguisher (required).
Actually, about 10 meters long
It is in front of the ramen/gyoza restaurant
This is where we can ass tables and sell
There will be 2 guards closing the street for non authorized cars (non resident).
YS (Yokai Soho) is at the East Entrance of the street
Here is the street plan
October 14
First of all, for the M... F... Yokai Parade, we'll of course have stands in front of Yokai Soho, but also 2 more places 10 meters West, in front of a bank.
Hello y'all, new market opportunities @yokaisoho in October!

Hello y'all! Next collective market @yokaisoho will be on Saturday November 25th. I know that it's still a bit early to talk about it but if you have things to sell/show/talk about then tell us about it; the momiji leaves will be red at Kitano Tenmangu, we'll stay warm under Yokai roof.

Strange sentence... I'll inform Last Fish of our discussions, and I'll keep you updated too :)
I'll inform Last Fish of our discussion and I'll inform him too.  I think that we can adapt this concept too.  Anyway, I wish you a good day.

Last Fish
For you interest, and as there is no much secret in this, I follow up Last Fish's answer. It's in Japanese, but no super complicated.

Is it possible to organize this in Kyoto? Is there any interest in this kind of gathering? Do you know anyone who would like to do it?  These are some basic questions.  But basically, I just want to talk about it and see if there is any potential here.  Getting some IDPW members help is possible.  The main question is what is the potential for this in Kyoto.  In my opinion, it can also be a Micro Yami-Ichi.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tHEw-Kky85A

messages.content: I have exchanged email with Last Fish, one member of IDPW in Tokyo, who are organizing the Yami-Ichi market.
Collective hello to everyone!
BenoÃ®t Jacquet added Masahiko Murakami to the group.
BenoÃ®t Jacquet added Elisa Tanaka to the group.
Lauren Kellie Hadler-Yokoyama left the group.
If you have other ideas, you can also share them. This event is a work in progress.

If you want to do a live performance, it's "funny" to say, but it's free too (yes, I know, artists may even have to pay to do shows in some great places in Japan). And you can sell related things (tapes, CDs, books, ...).
If you want to exhibit something, that you may not want to sell, it's possible too, then you do not need to indicate a price.
It's free from any commission.

Feel free to follow the thread, leave it if you do not feel concerned or add anyone who could feel concerned.  And I wish y'all a good Golden Week!

There is an interesting event today at Okazaki Koen, perhaps relatable to your collective market.  http://sakyo-wonder.com/
Amazing name!
I would love to go but I am playing with the Shabon Dama Parade Band at Heian Jingu from noon.
FYI, last time we had this: https://www.facebook.com/events/280047289096447/?ti=icl
It would be good to have the 3D printer running on these days. I'm sure that some people would even like to have their 3D models being materialized.
Yeah and also stuff made with Connor
Great, Gohan Tapes?
Sounds good benoit I'm down for a shop and playing
Having "happenings", during this weekend, would also be great.  I'd like to add the "party" aspect being well present, and not be another "flea Market" in town.  Let's make it innovative.
There's also a micro art fair aspect.  What we did not have last time is the "organic" aspect, but @Chuck would most probably be present this time.

The Collective Market main idea is to gather people around common but also broad interests.  I don't take any commissions on sales.  Artists and creators do also have the possibility to do live performances (and eventually sell their things too).  It's interesting to have different types of shops so that we learn from each other, prepare future collaborations, but also do not see each other as competitors.  We may not have 2 shops selling the same things too.

Today, I have also posted on the ã³ã¬ã¯ãã£ã Collective FB page, and I'll create an event when the purpose of the market will be a bit more well defined, so as the main collaborations.  I like to launch the FB many weeks in advance, because everyone is busy here.
Of course, we can also have parallel discussions if you have more personal questions and do not  want to bother the whole group with them.

We have almost 2 months to think about it and it will start as a work in progress, with a list of shops and participants growing until the last weeks.  So, if the last participants to the "Pop-up Micro Market and Art Fair" are ready to do it again, this would be a good base to start with.  @Sabrina, if you have any advice and ideas, that would be much appreciated too.

As last month, the Kitano Tenmangu market will be on a weekend, so it's a good opportunity to redo some pop-up shops like last time, and try to go one step further with the concept of Arts, Techs, Design, and, this time, sustainability, i.e., involving makers of all kind who work locally.  Having also local food would be great.  For instance, OK Fields locally grown vegetables. Last time we had about 8 shops, I think we have have twice more.  The main challenge is to remain coherent and have a certain "esthetic". Esthetics in their original sense: as a pleasure of senses.
Hi Ben, tnx for adding me to the conversation. What kind of things do you plan to host then?

BenoÃ®t named the group Collective Market.

Hello everyone, this is a collective message, feel free to leave the conversation if you do not feel concerned, or to add people who could feel concerned.  I wrote to you as you have taken part to some last events or to some discussion related to the Collective group coming out from Yokai Soho.  One next project that we would like to work on is the next "Collective Market" which could be organized during the last week-end of June, 24-25 (Saturday-Sunday).
